item.title: Large reoccurring puddle on road and pavement, 27th January
item.description:
Outside number 43 Priors Road. The puddle appears every time it rains due to water running down the lane - recently made worse by mud being brought down onto the pavement and road by vehicles on the lane. The sitting water takes up more than half the road and all the pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harp Hill Footpath, Whaddon, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Sign structurally damaged/leaning more than 20 degrees/loose in ground (Non illuminating sign)

item.title: Multiple potholes along poorly laid linear utilities repair, 27th January
item.description:
Multiple potholes along a linear utility repair, some deep, some linear almost cracks where tarmac join broken down. The utility repair itself stands approx 1” proof of the road surface as it is. They are the position on the roadway where you cycle so pose a real danger to vulnerable road users. To avoid them you either drive too close to parked cars (outside a nursery where they are opened suddenly at drop offs or out into the road on the approach to a junction with cars passing to close. One of these holes has been previously patched.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 105, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two manhole covers at centre of Hare & Hounds junction have sunk and sound like a firing gun when cars from both ways travel over them. Also left on the side barriers which have been forgotten. These were used when the traffic light was replaced., 26th January
item.description:
